overview: This year marks the 30th anniversary of film-maker Derek Jarmanâ€™s canonisation by an activist group of gay male 'nuns' known as the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence. At the time in 1991, Derek Jarman was the most prominent person in the UK living openly with HIV. He was outspoken, radical and unapologetically queer.
tagline: The canonisation of Derek Jarman by queer 'nuns'
title: Saintmaking
